titles.title: Veterans Travel Tax Relief Act of 2015

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for a deduction for travel expenses to medical centers of the Department of Veterans Affairs in connection with examinations or treatments relating to service-connected disabilities.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:
1/7/2015--Introduced. Veterans Travel Tax Relief Act of 2015
Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow veterans a deduction from gross income, up to $400 a year, for their travel expenses, including those of a family member, to a Department of Veterans Affairs medical center for treatment related to a service-connected disability or for an examination related to a claim for disability compensation or a pension.
